question: Given a large dataset of audio recordings, describe at least three feature-extraction techniques (e.g., Mel-spectrogram, log-Mel, MFCC) and discuss the pros and cons of each for a SER task.
transcript: I'm Haneen Ahmad, the British University of Egypt, senior AI student. I have worked with such feature-technique structures and techniques made and Reck-Malice Book of Ram, the lab-Mal and FCC. Each of them has a person count and feature-emotional recognition tasks. MFCC, I guess, is like a transformer-based, secret-struction technique that can be used before fitting the features into the network. So the features are converted into embedding, and these embedding are fed into the network, and this network makes production and this production are evaluated using every user. And mass functions and...
